intro: Lithocardium hypoleucum, commonly known as the white-leaved rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, low-growing form. The plant features narrow, silver-gray leaves and produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Lithocardium hypoleucum is valued for its ornamental appeal and adaptability to harsh conditions.
